message_1: A group of 5 friends want to choose 2 representatives to attend a meeting. How many different pairs of representatives can they choose from the group?
message_2:
To determine the number of different pairs of representatives that can be chosen from the group, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of friends (5) and k is the number of representatives to be chosen (2).

C(5, 2) = 5! / (2!(5-2)!)
C(5, 2) = 120 / (2! * 3!)
C(5, 2) = 120 / (2 * 6)
C(5, 2) = 120 / 12
C(5, 2) = 10

So, there are 10 different pairs of representatives that can be chosen from the group.
